translations.translation: Abraham was kind, compassionate, and penitent.
Surely Abraham was forbearing, tenderhearted and oft-turning to Allah.
Abraham was certainly a forbearing, compassionate, and tender-hearted person.
Indeed Ibrahim is most forbearing, very soft hearted, penitent.
Verily, Ibrahim was, without doubt, forbearing, used to invoke Allah with humility, and was repentant.
Most surely Ibrahim was forbearing, tender-hearted, oft-returning (to Allah):
Lo! Abraham was mild, imploring, penitent.
for Abraham was forbearing, tender-hearted and oft-returning to God.
Verily Ibrahim was forbearing, long-suffering, penitent.
Abraham was indeed most forbearing, plaintive, [and] penitent.
For Abraham was, without doubt, forbearing (of faults), compassionate, and given to look to Allah.
Verily, Ibrahim (Abraham) was, without doubt, forbearing, used to invoke Allah with humility, and was repentant (to Allah all the time, again and again).
indeed, Abraham was forbearing, tenderhearted and penitent.
Indeed, Abraham was forbearing, grieving and [frequently] returning [to Allah].

[11:75] Assuredly Abraham was forbearing, long-suffering, imploring, penitent, always returning [to God] in repentance: thus he said to them, ‘Would you destroy a town in which there are 300 believers?’ They said, ‘No’. He said, ‘Would you destroy a town in which there are 200 believers?’ They said, ‘No’. He said, ‘Would you destroy a town in which there are 40 believers?’ They said, ‘No’. He said, ‘Would you destroy a town in which there are 14 believers?’ They said, ‘No’. He said, ‘What if there were one believer in it?’ They said, ‘No’. He said, ‘Lot is in it’. They said, ‘We know full well who is in it’ … to the end [of the narrative].
(Lo! Abraham was mild) in the face of ignorance, (imploring) compassionate, (penitent) devoted to Allah. 235

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: وما حمله على المجادلة والمناجاة في حقهم إلا فرط إشافقه ورقة قلبه { إِنَّ إِبْرَاهِيمَ } في نفسه { لَحَلِيمٌ } غير عجول على الانتقام، كظيم الغيظ والغضب { أَوَّاهٌ } كثير التأوه والتأسف من الذنب الصادر عنه { مُّنِيبٌ } [هود: 75] رجاع إلى الله في جميع حالاته، فقاس حالهم على نفسه، فأخذ يجادل في حقهم؟

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
[العنكبوت: 32]، { إنَّ إبراهيمَ لحليمٌ } ، غير عجول من الانتقام إلى من أساء اليه
 { أواهٌ } كثير التأوه والتأسف على الناس، { منيب } ، راجع إلى الله
 والمقصود من ذلك: بيان الحامل له على المجادلة، وهي: رقة قلبه وفرط ترحمه
